Here's your roadmap for the semester! Each day, follow the general process outlined below:

-   Enjoy the notes / text <i class="fas fa-book-open"></i>

-   Attend class, review the <i class="fas fa-pencil-alt"></i> worksheet and solutions if you have any questions after working on it during class.  <i class="fas fa-desktop"></i> Slides from class are linked below. 

-   Discuss the reflection questions <i class="fas fa-lightbulb"></i> and ethics considerations <i class="fas fa-balance-scale"></i> (see the <i class="fas fa-book-open"></i> <a href = "https://ds002r-fds.netlify.app/notes" target = "_blank">class notes</a>) with your classmates and professor.

-   The textbooks are <b> <a href = "https://mdsr-book.github.io/mdsr3e/" target = "_blank">Modern Data Science with R (MDSR), 3rd edition</a></b> by Baumer, Kaplan, and Horton and <b> <a href = "https://r4ds.hadley.nz/" target = "_blank">R for Data Science (R4DS), 2nd edition</a></b> by Wickham, Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel, and Grolemund.

-   Homework assignments are found at the <a href = "https://github.com/orgs/ST47S-FODS-Fall2025/repositories" target = "_blank">GitHub course organization</a>.  Due dates are provided on each assignment (roughly every other week).  See the <a href = "https://ds002r-fds.netlify.app/github">course GitHub page</a> for more information on how to find, complete, and submit assignments.
